greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least m such that the average number of divisors of all integers from 1 to m equals n, or 0 if no such number exists.
comment: "In 1838 Lejeune Dirichlet (1805-1859) proved that (1/n)*sum_{r=1..n} #(divisors(r)), the average number of divisors of all integers from 1 to n, approaches ln n + 2gamma - 1 as n increases." [Havil]
reference: Julian Havil, "Gamma: Exploring Euler's Constant", Princeton University Press, Princeton and Oxford, pp. 112-113, 2003.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..40
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Jul 06 2003
ext: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 07 2003
Missing terms a(16)-a(17) and a(20)-a(29) added by _Donovan Johnson_, Dec 21 2008
